artist: artist: Utagawa Kunisada; publisher: Iseya Kanekichi; carver: Yokogawa Takejirō
creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
Written in rectangular: {Tokube} (character\'s name) | Poem by Ki no Tomonori: 
{Yūsare ba / Saho no kawara no / Kawakaze ni / Tomo madowasete / Chidoro nanknari} (When evening comes / To the bank of the Soho river / In the breeze from the river / Plover which lost its friends / Crying for them)
markings: date seal: 子十 {ne jū} (Rat 10) | censor seals: 福 {Fuku} | 村松 {Muramatsu} | carver\'s seal: {hori Take} | publisher\'s seal:
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The Visual Parody of the Thirty-Six Selected Poets (Mitate sanjūrokkasen no uchi 見立三十六歌撰之内)
signed: in toshidama cartouche: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga}
title: (Kabuki Scene with a Tomonori's Poem)
